intro: Protasparagus gonoclados, commonly known as the red spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a garden plant.
